snippet.title: "Brain Minigame" test footage from POPGOES Finale (info in description)
snippet.description:
0:08 - First minigame beta (Balloon Boy & Toy Freddy corruptions)
0:50 - Grave Stone "sighting"
2:04 - Second minigame test (Toy Chica & Mangle corruptions)

POPGOES Finale was going to have 3D brain minigames that happened in between the normal memory chapters (and before the Strings/Fritz dialogue sections), in which you would find and destroy corruptions of the Toy animatronics.

Three brain minigames were planned, but only two had any progress. The first one was mostly finished with completed sprites and a functioning map, but with some features that weren't finalised (like rivers that could only be crossed with floating platforms). 

These were all programmed by LSFDevelopment using some standard "3D dungeon" tutorials for Game Maker. The game page for POPGOES Finale, which includes a playable demo and the entire soundtrack, is available here: https://gamejolt.com/games/pf/342105

For those who are familiar with the original 3D brain minigame concept that was planned for POPGOES Reprinted (and the playable demo we released for it), you'll notice that the player movement for this is quite different from that. In this version, you can only move in a grid, like a checkerboard. This is a limitation to the method we used that gave opportunity for more claustrophobic and challenging gameplay. It allowed us to add "jumpscares" like that of Grave Stone at 0:50, which consists of a single image that can only be visible when you fully turn a corner out of nowhere. Quite cool in practice!
